metadata.title: CVE-2017-3273 on Ubuntu 18.04 LTS (bionic) - medium
metadata.description:
Vulnerability in the MySQL Server component of Oracle MySQL (subcomponent:Server: DDL). Supported versions that are affected are 5.6.34 and earlierand 5.7.16 and earlier. Easily exploitable vulnerability allows lowprivileged attacker with network access via multiple protocols tocompromise MySQL Server. Successful attacks of this vulnerability canresult in unauthorized ability to cause a hang or frequently repeatablecrash (complete DOS) of MySQL Server. CVSS v3.0 Base Score 6.5(Availability impacts).

    Update Instructions:

    Run `sudo pro fix CVE-2017-3273` to fix the vulnerability. The problem can be corrected
    by updating your system to the following package versions:

libmysqlclient20 - 5.7.17-0ubuntu1
mysql-client - 5.7.17-0ubuntu1
mysql-client-5.7 - 5.7.17-0ubuntu1
mysql-client-core-5.7 - 5.7.17-0ubuntu1
mysql-server - 5.7.17-0ubuntu1
mysql-server-5.7 - 5.7.17-0ubuntu1
mysql-server-core-5.7 - 5.7.17-0ubuntu1
mysql-source-5.7 - 5.7.17-0ubuntu1
mysql-testsuite - 5.7.17-0ubuntu1
mysql-testsuite-5.7 - 5.7.17-0ubuntu1
No subscription required

criterions.comment: mysql-5.7 package in bionic was vulnerable but has been fixed (note: '5.7.17-0ubuntu1').
